results.definition: transmit or serve as the medium for transmission
examples: The airwaves carry the sound

results.definition: transfer (entries) from one account book to another
have with oneself; have on one's person
examples: I always carry money

results.definition: drink alcohol without showing ill effects
examples: he had drunk more than he could carry

results.definition: serve as a means for expressing something
include as the content; broadcast or publicize

examples: Do you carry kerosene heaters?

results.definition: move while supporting, either in a vehicle or in one's hands or on one's body
examples: You must carry your camping gear
carry the suitcases to the car
This train is carrying nuclear waste
These pipes carry waste water into the river

results.definition: support or hold in a certain manner

synonyms: have a bun in the oven
examples: I am carrying his child
This land will carry ten cows to the acre
this land does not carry olives

results.definition: bear or be able to bear the weight, pressure,or responsibility of
examples: How many credits is this student carrying?
We carry a very large mortgage

results.definition: be conveyed over a certain distance
be equipped with (a mast or sail)
examples: This boat can only carry a small sail

results.definition: be necessarily associated with or result in or involve
compensate for a weaker partner or member by one's own performance
examples: I resent having to carry her all the time

results.definition: cover a certain distance or advance beyond

examples: carry too far

results.definition: have as an inherent or characteristic feature or have as a consequence
examples: These bonds carry warrants

results.definition: have on the surface or on the skin
examples: carry scars
I carry her image in my mind's eye
I will carry the secret to my grave
I carry these thoughts in the back of my head
I carry a lot of life insurance

results.definition: pursue a line of scent or be a bearer
examples: the dog was taught to fetch and carry

results.definition: secure the passage or adoption (of bills and motions)
sing or play against other voices or parts
examples: He cannot carry a tune
carry a cause

results.definition: transfer (a number, cipher, or remainder) to the next column or unit's place before or after, in addition or multiplication
examples: put down 5 and carry 2
